name: Do-It-Yourself Salmon Poke Bowls
author: A Day In the Kitchen
summary: Salmon poke bowls are easy to make in your own home! Buy your favorite toppings and enjoy a totally custom poke bowl for cheaper than buying it at a restaurant.
ingredients: ¾ pound sashimi-grade salmon, cut into small cubes
1  red bell pepper, sliced, or more to taste
¼ cup shelled edamame, or more to taste
4 sheets dried seaweed, cut into strips, or to taste
1 tablespoon pickled ginger, or to taste
1 tablespoon furikake (Japanese nori seasoning), or to taste
2 tablespoons chopped green onion, or to taste
1 tablespoon sesame seeds, or to taste
directions: Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and chile oil in a bowl to make dressing
Top bowls with avocado, red bell pepper, edamame, seaweed, pickled ginger, and furikake seasoning
Garnish with chopped green onion a sprinkling of sesame seeds
